item.title: 2-Hours Guided Segway Tour in Coeur d'Alene
item.description: Discover the best of Coeur d’Alene, Idaho on a guided Segway tour through town. Join a small group and get a brief Segway lesson before heading off. Stop at key landmarks such as McEuen Park, Fort Sherman, Independence Park, and the North Idaho Centennial Trail. As you glide through town, your guide regales you with facts and stories about Coeur d’Alene.

image.alt: 2-Hours Guided Segway Tour in Coeur d'Alene

item.title: Full Day Rafting Trip
item.description: Take to the water for an adrenaline-fuelled white water rafting adventure along Idaho’s Salmon River, the ‘River of No Return’. Enjoy spectacular views as you paddle through the canyon and tackle thrilling rapids, then jump in to cool off with a swim or inflatable kayak ride. End your tour with a delicious lunch by the beachside.

image.alt: Full Day Rafting Trip

item.title: Hells Canyon Kirkwood Jet Boat Tour near Boise, Idaho
item.description: Explore the Wild River section of the Snake River in an exciting way with a jet boat ride through Hells Canyon, located on the border of Oregon and Idaho. Home to large rapids, this is where the canyon is at its deepest, providing scenery from rock walls to grasslands to alpine forest. As you speed along the river, listen to commentary from the captain about this region's Native American and ranching history. The tour departs from the south entrance of Hells Canyon.

image.alt: Hells Canyon Kirkwood Jet Boat Tour near Boise, Idaho

item.title: Guided Half-Day Tour to Shoshone Falls & City Tour
item.description: Discover the “Niagara of the West” on a half-day tour to Shoshone Falls from Twin Falls, Idaho. Join a small group and travel to the cascading waterfalls on the Snake River and the hydroelectric power plant. Then, head back to Twin Falls for a tour of the city, stopping at the Old Town, warehouse, and downtown districts to explore.

image.alt: Guided Half-Day Tour to Shoshone Falls & City Tour

item.title: Private Yellowstone Wildlife Sightseeing Tour
item.description: If you're hoping to see wildlife in Yellowstone National Park, increase your chances of spotting magnificent animals like wolves, elk, pronghorn sheep, birds of prey, and even bears on this private wildlife tour. It can be daunting to navigate the massive park on your own, but your dedicated driver and guide knows all the best habitats to increase your chances of wildlife sightings on this full-day tour.

image.alt: Private Yellowstone Wildlife Sightseeing Tour

item.title: Zipline Adventure in the Snake River Canyon
item.description: Embark on an unforgettable journey with us, where you'll soar through the breathtaking Snake River Canyon at breakneck speeds of 25 mph on our thrilling four-line zip course. Get your heart racing and immerse yourself in the raw beauty of the canyon as you glide through the air and soak up fascinating stories of the canyon's history, geology, and the diverse flora and fauna that call it home. With the final line measuring a staggering 1750 feet, longer than the Perrine Bridge itself, you're in for a truly epic experience that will leave you feeling exhilarated and inspired. All activities take place in Centennial Waterfront Park, Twin Falls, Idaho. Min weight 50 lbs, max weight 260 lbs. Close toed shoes required

image.alt: Zipline Adventure in the Snake River Canyon

item.title: Private Yellowstone Old Faithful and Lower Loop Tour
item.description: From Old Faithful to Fountain Paint Pot, you’ll see Yellowstone National Park highlights on this full-day tour from Island Park or West Yellowstone. Exploring with a personal guide who knows the landscape, wildlife, and secret spots is a great way to discover the national park's most gorgeous places. Using a spotting scope and binoculars, watch for bison, elk, bears, and wolves as you make your way through Hayden Valley.

image.alt: Private Yellowstone Old Faithful and Lower Loop Tour

item.title: Boise River Guided Rafting, Swimming and Wildlife Tour
item.description: Hit the rapids on the Boise River with this hassle-free, small, intimate group tour. All of your safety gear, plus splash tops and bottoms, are provided, so you’ll stay as safe and comfortable as possible. This is an intimate group, so you’ll have plenty of attention from your guide. Besides rafting, you can swim and relax, all the while keeping an eye out for local wildlife along the river.

image.alt: Boise River Guided Rafting, Swimming and Wildlife Tour

item.title: Guided Kayak Tour to Shoshone Falls
item.description: The guided kayak tour to Shoshone Falls offers an unforgettable experience of one of Idaho's most spectacular natural wonders. You will paddle a solo kayak guided by experienced and certified guides. Located in Centennial Waterfront Park, Twin Falls, Idaho.

image.alt: Guided Kayak Tour to Shoshone Falls

item.title: 1/2 Day Whitewater Rafting Trip near Boise, ID
item.description:
We offer the complete Idaho whitewater rafting trip. Only 40 minutes from Boise, this trip is sure to be a highlight of the summer.
This stretch of river is great for rafters of all skill levels-from families with young kids to those who just love the thrill of whitewater. Please visit our website for more information or contact us with any questions.

image.alt: 1/2 Day Whitewater Rafting Trip near Boise, ID

item.title: Riggins Idaho 1-day Rafting Trip on the Salmon River
item.description: The Salmon River—aka the ‘River of No Return’—is one of the most popular destinations for white water rafting in Idaho. On this tour, spend a full day on the water, tackle thrilling waves and Class III rapids in a white water raft or inflatable kayak, and stop along the way to swim, relax, and tuck into a delicious lunch by the beachside.

image.alt: Riggins Idaho 1-day Rafting Trip on the Salmon River

item.title: 1/2 Day Afternoon Rafting Trip
item.description: Navigate the Salmon River on this small group whitewater rafting tour, where your guide will take you to one of several rapids including Time Zone, Black Rock, Tight Squeeze, and more. Along the way you’ll stop for a break at the beach for some drinks and cookies to keep you fueled up. Enjoy around 3.5 hours for this small-group adventure.

image.alt: 1/2 Day Afternoon Rafting Trip

item.title: UTV Tour of Sawtell Peak
item.description: Our UTV tour promises breathtaking views. You will go to Sawtell Peak which itself is known for its sweeping vistas of the surrounding landscapes, including expansive forests and distant mountain ranges. The UTV tour offers a unique opportunity to explore this stunning wilderness up close, navigating through trails that wind through forests, over hills, and along ridges.

image.alt: UTV Tour of Sawtell Peak

item.title: UTV Rental in North Idaho
item.description: Discover the best of North Idaho’s rugged scenery and trails on a utility terrain vehicle (UTV). Pre-book your UTV and set off to explore on your own or with your group. This rental gives you the flexibility to go where you want and discover several beautiful landscapes. From mountaintop vistas to multiple lakes, the area is chock full of places to visit.

image.alt: UTV Rental in North Idaho

item.title: Guided Half-Day Scenic Tour - Off The Beaten Path
item.description: Go off the beaten path and visit five of the less-visited attractions in the Magic Valley, including scenic and historic sites, on this guided small-group half-day sightseeing tour. Travel from Twin Falls to see highlights such as the Box Canyon Springs Preserve, Malad Gorge State Park, Hagerman, Hagerman National Fish Hatchery and Balanced Rock.

image.alt: Guided Half-Day Scenic Tour - Off The Beaten Path

item.title: Full-Day Whitewater Rafting Tour on the Salmon River
item.description: Paddle through peaceful sections mixed with thrilling class II-III rapids and learn about the natural history of the Salmon Valley. Includes a tasty riverside lunch; historic gold mine tour; talented, experienced guides; and option to purchase photo at end of trip.

image.alt: Full-Day Whitewater Rafting Tour on the Salmon River

item.title: Riggins Idaho half-day rafting trip on the Salmon River
item.description: Riggings, Idaho, is one of the best places to go rafting in the US. Take this half-day rafting tour on the Salmon River, and safety travel through different levels of whitewater with a guide who gives an orientation beforehand. Plus, this tour makes your experience stress free with a snack, all gear, and round-trip transport from the meeting spot included.

image.alt: Riggins Idaho half-day rafting trip on the Salmon River

item.title: 2-Day Private Yellowstone Tour(Lower and Upper Loops w Iconic Sites) w Lunch
item.description: Explore the first National Park in the world with our Adventure Guides who will show you the best of the park’s stunning sites while you simply relax and take in the views. This 2-day tour includes the iconic sites on both the Lower and Upper Loops, including the Grand Prismatic Spring, Hayden Valley, Old Faithful, and Yellowstone Lake. Daily pick-up and drop-off at your hotel with a provided breakfast and lunch.

image.alt: 2-Day Private Yellowstone Tour(Lower and Upper Loops w Iconic Sites) w Lunch

item.title: Guided Half-Day Tour Scenic Adventure & Wine Tasting Tour
item.description: Combine stunning natural scenery with wine tasting on this unique tour around the Magic Valley of southern Idaho. Explore the Malad Gorge and drive the 1000 Springs Scenic Byway in Hagerman Valley. Afterwards, enjoy wine tasting at the family-owned Helesinsky Vineyard and Winery, known for their organic wines made using French techniques.

image.alt: Guided Half-Day Tour Scenic Adventure & Wine Tasting Tour

item.title: Salmon River Whitewater Rafting in Riggins, Idaho
item.description:
The Adventure Idaho Difference:
At Adventure Idaho, our full-day rafting trips stand out for their exclusive river side stop on our private deck for lunch. Our private deck offers a scenic backdrop, perfect for relaxing and socializing with your group in the heart of Idaho's wilderness. Beyond the thrill of navigating the rapids, this peaceful interlude on our private deck adds a touch of luxury and comfort to your adventure, making it an unforgettable experience. With Adventure Idaho, it's not just about the journey down the river; it's about creating moments that last a lifetime.

image.alt: Salmon River Whitewater Rafting in Riggins, Idaho

item.title: Full-Day Whitewater Rafting Trip on Salmon River with Lunch
item.description: Take an adventurous trip down the Salmon River with this whitewater rafting trip departing from Spring Bar. You and your guide will spend around eight hours in total traversing the 22-mile stretch of scenic river, with a stop along the way for swimming, sunbathing, frisbee, and a catered beachfront lunch.

image.alt: Full-Day Whitewater Rafting Trip on Salmon River with Lunch

item.title: Guided Full-Day Tour to Craters of the Moon National Monument & Preserve
item.description: Spend the day exploring the lunar-like landscapes of Crater of the Moon National Monument on this excursion from Twin Falls. Discover the park’s most important landmarks including Devils Orchard and the Inferno cone on guided walks. You also learn how the Apollo astronauts used the area to prepare for the moon landing in 1969.

image.alt: Guided Full-Day Tour to Craters of the Moon National Monument & Preserve

item.title: Guided Off-Road Vehicle Tours in North Idaho Forests
item.description: To truly appreciate the wild beauty of North Idaho's forests, go off-roading on this adrenaline-fueled ATV tour from Coeur d'Alene. Rumble along dirt trails that other vehicles can't access for unmatched views of the mountains and the Fernan, Coeur d'Alene, and Haydend alpine lakes. Drive solo as your guide leads away, or ride with up to four people in one ATV for a family adventure.

image.alt: Guided Off-Road Vehicle Tours in North Idaho Forests

item.title: Guided Half-Day Tour to Dierkes Lake & Shoshone Falls
item.description: Combine two scenic attractions on one visit with this guided half-day tour to Shoshone Falls State Park in Twin Falls. Hike around Dierkes Lake on a moderate trail to two hidden lakes, while learning about the flora, fauna and geology along the way. Enjoy sweeping views of the Snake River Canyon from the rim. At Shoshone Falls, enjoy aerial and close-up views from two viewpoints.

image.alt: Guided Half-Day Tour to Dierkes Lake & Shoshone Falls
